2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: 近道しようとしたら　雑草がすごくて迷ちゃったよ
2.english: I was trying to take a shortcut, but the weeds were so thick that I got lost.

3.speaker: SASAKO
3.japanese: そうなの　迷ちゃうお客さんもいるみたい
3.english: Yes, I've heard other customers have gotten lost, too.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: 隣なのに家から20分かかちゃったよ
4.english: I live next door, but it took me twenty minutes to get here. These weeds are thick. Let's sit inside.

5.speaker: POLAR BEAR
5.english: Okay, let's do it! What are you doing, Polar Bear?

6.speaker: POLAR BEAR
6.japanese: テラスで風を感じながら キンキンに冷したミントティーを飲んでる
6.english: I'm enjoying the cool breeze as I sit on the terrace drinking an ice cold mint tea.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.japanese: なんで僕に君の店の雑草取りさせて
8.english: Why am I weeding your café's lawn

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: 君がテラスをすすんでるの
9.english: while you're sitting there, drinking tea?!

10.speaker: POLAR BEAR
10.japanese: 僕は普通寒いところにいるでしょう
10.english: I usually live where it's cold.

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.japanese: 真夏に雑草取りをするペンギンなんて どこの世界にいるの
12.english: In what world is there a penguin who weeds in the middle of summer?!

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: らまさん　どこ行くの
15.english: Mr. Llama, where are you going?

16.speaker: LLAMA
16.japanese: もう食べられないんで　失礼しようかなって
16.english: I can't eat anymore, so I figured I'd leave.

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: ちょっと待って　なんで帰ちゃうの
17.english: Wait a minute. Why are you going home?

18.japanese: 僕たちの雑草取り始まったばかりでしょう

19.speaker: LLAMA
19.japanese: けど　もうお腹いっぱいですよ

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: 雑草取りって　そういうことじゃないでしょう
20.english: But weeding is much more than that.

21.speaker: PENGUIN
21.japanese: もうちょっと頑張ろうよ

22.speaker: LLAMA
22.japanese: 僕　もうお腹はじけちゃいますよ

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.english: That's not what I meant... Um... is there any way to weedthat doesn't involve eating?

24.speaker: LLAMA
24.japanese: そうでしたか　ちょっと考えてみます
24.english: Oh, I see. Let me think.

28.speaker: POLAR BEAR
28.japanese: ミントティー　どう？
28.english: Would you like some mint tea?

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.japanese: もう　皆　頑張ろうよ
30.english: Come on, guys. Let's work harder!

31.speaker: KOALA
31.japanese: 頑張りたいんだけど　僕ユーカリしか食べられなっくて
31.english: I'd like to try harder, but I can only eat eucalyptus.

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.japanese: だから　食べない方法もあるんじゃないかな
32.english: I'm saying... there are other ways to weedthat don't involve eating.

34.speaker: PANDA
34.english: I found a weird shaped rock.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: 要らないの　その報告は　雑草取ろう
35.english: We didn't need to know that. Let's get rid of some weeds.

40.speaker: SASAKO
40.english: I guess you didn't need to know that.

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: 僕だけかな　雑草取り真面目にやってるの
46.english: Am I the only one that's taking this seriously?

50.speaker: PENGUIN
50.japanese: やる気はあるんだけどな

51.speaker: PANDA
51.english: The air conditioning is so cool.

52.speaker: PANDA
52.japanese: ねぇ　笹持ってきて　お母さん
52.english: Hey, Mom, could you bring me some bamboo grass?

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.english: It's nice and cool, isn't it?

54.speaker: PANDA
54.japanese: あ　ペンギンさん何してるの
54.english: Oh, Mr. Penguin, what are you doing here?

55.speaker: PENGUIN
55.japanese: 何してるのじゃないよパンダ君　雑草取りは？
55.english: What do you mean what am I doing here?! What happened to weeding?!

56.speaker: PANDA
56.japanese: ペンギンさんはなんでそんなに雑草取りがすきなの
56.english: Why do you like weeding so much, Mr. Penguin?

58.speaker: PENGUIN
58.japanese: けど　このままじゃ一日じゃ終わらないよ
58.english: But at this rate, we won't finish today!

61.speaker: PANDA
61.japanese: うん　昼寝してからすぐ行くよ
61.english: Okay. I'll be there right after my nap. Don't suck me up!

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.japanese: ちょっと　何してるの
67.english: Hey, now. What are you doing?

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: らまさん　お腹いっぱいだって言ってたでしょう
69.english: Didn't you say you were full, Mr. Llama?!

70.speaker: LLAMA
70.japanese: バーベキューは別腹ですよ
70.english: Barbecue goes into a separate stomach.

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.japanese: 聞いたことないよ　そんな言葉
71.english: I've never heard anything like that!

72.speaker: SASAKO
72.japanese: ペンギンさん　そこで拾った土偶です
72.english: Mr. Penguin, I found this clay figure over there.

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.japanese: だから　すごいんだけれど　要らないよ　その報告は
74.english: That's amazing and all, but we didn't need to know that.

75.speaker: PANDA
75.english: Let me see! Let me see!

78.speaker: LLAMA
78.japanese: ありがとうございます

82.speaker: LLAMA
82.english: It's not that hard at all.

85.speaker: PENGUIN
85.japanese: 誰も僕を見習って頑張ろうとしないなんて
85.english: No one is following my exampleof working hard.

88.speaker: PENGUIN
88.japanese: 何　笹子さん　また土偶？
88.english: What is it, Miss Sasako? Another clay figure?

89.speaker: SASAKO
89.japanese: いいえ　皆でここだけはやったんですよ
89.english: No. We actually all got this section done.

91.speaker: PANDA
91.japanese: この木陰なら涼しいし
91.english: Mr. Llama said it would be cooler in the shade and you'd be able to rest here.

92.speaker: LLAMA
92.japanese: テラスが日が射してきちゃって
92.english: The sun was pretty strong on the terrace.

94.speaker: POLAR BEAR
94.japanese: 友達と一緒に賑やかにできたほうがいいなぁって
94.english: I thought it'd be a lot more fun if we did this all together.

95.speaker: POLAR BEAR
95.japanese: だって　みんなでこうしてるだけで　楽しいよ
95.english: Because... it's fun just having everyone together.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.japanese: 僕大事なこと忘れてたみたい
97.english: It seems I forgot something rather important.

98.speaker: POLAR BEAR
98.japanese: ミントティー　飲む？
98.english: Would you like some mint tea?

100.speaker: SASAKO
100.japanese: 私たちは　雑草取りに戻りましょうか
100.english: The rest of us should get back to weeding.

102.speaker: SASAKO
102.japanese: ペンギンさんは休んでてください
102.english: Please take it easy, Mr. Penguin.

104.speaker: LLAMA
104.japanese: もう一頑張りしますか
104.english: Let's give it another go. I can't eat anymore... It's your turn, Mr. Penguin.

109.speaker: LLAMA
109.japanese: バービキュ食べ過ぎて　僕もう草は食べられません
109.english: I ate too much barbecue and can't eat any more weeds.

111.speaker: GRIZZLY
111.japanese: 何だよ　このクソ暑い中に呼び出しやがって
111.english: What the hell do you want, calling me over in this damn heat?

112.speaker: POLAR BEAR
112.japanese: 庭の雑草が伸びちゃってさ
112.english: The yard was getting overgrown with weeds.

113.speaker: GRIZZLY
113.english: The weeds in the yard? You aren't thinking about asking me to pull the weeds, are you, Polar Bear?!

116.speaker: GRIZZLY
116.english: What do you mean, could I?!

118.speaker: PENGUIN
118.japanese: なんて　暴力的で　なんて　丁寧な仕事だ
118.english: Such violent, yet such careful work.

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.japanese: 暴風のように去っていた
122.english: And then he left like a storm.

124.speaker: POLAR BEAR
124.japanese: ぺんぎんさんにも迷惑かけちゃったし
124.english: I've caused you a lot of trouble, Mr. Penguin.

127.speaker: KOALA
127.japanese: やぁ　今日は働いたね

128.speaker: SASAKO
128.japanese: 白熊さんもこっちに来て飲みましょう
128.english: You should come over here and have a drink, too, Mr. Polar Bear.

131.speaker: PENGUIN
131.english: What did you want to talk about, Polar Bear?

133.speaker: PENGUIN
133.japanese: どうしたの　僕でよかったら相談に乗るよ
133.english: What's the matter? I'll be happy to listen.

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.japanese: たった数日でこんなに伸びたの
135.english: It's only been a few days and they grew this much?!

136.speaker: POLAR BEAR
136.japanese: 夏の雑草は　伸びるの早いんだよ
136.english: The weeds grow fast in the summer.

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: 僕が手伝う理由が見えないんだけど
137.english: I'm not seeing why I should help here.

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.japanese: ほら　僕は寒いところの生き物だから
138.english: You know, because I'm an animal that's from a cold place.

139.speaker: PENGUIN
139.english: I'm telling you, so am I! This is a clay figure I just found.

140.speaker: PENGUIN
140.japanese: 笹子さん　その報告はもういいから
140.english: Miss Sasako, we really don't need to hear that anymore.

141.speaker: SASAKO
141.english: It's totally summer. It is summer.

142.speaker: SASAKO
142.japanese: 今年は蝉がよく泣きますね
142.english: You can hear the cicadas quite well this year.

143.speaker: POLAR BEAR
143.japanese: 雄は腹腔内の発音筋と発音膜で音を出して共鳴室で音を大きく出して雌を呼んでるね
143.english: The males use their internal sound-producing organ and sound-producing membrane to produce the sound, then use their resonance chamber to amplify the sound to call upon the females.

144.speaker: SASAKO
144.japanese: 情緒のない言い方やめてくれますか
144.english: Could you stop saying things with so little emotion?

146.speaker: PENGUIN
146.japanese: 食べないの　パンダあんぱん
146.english: Don't you want a panda red bean bun?

148.speaker: PANDA
148.japanese: 毎日パンじゃなくて　たまには高級フルーツでも買ってきてよ
148.english: Instead of bread everyday, could you buy some fancy fruits once in a while?

149.speaker: PENGUIN
149.japanese: 果物屋にはペン子さんがいないじゃない
149.english: But Miss Penko isn't at the fruit shop.

151.speaker: PENGUIN
151.english: What is it? Do you want some bread?

152.speaker: SASAKO
152.japanese: いいえ　そうじゃなくて

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: ペンギンさん　夏にはペン子さんに告白してドライブって言ってませんでしたっけ
153.english: Didn't you say that, come summer,you'd confess your love to Miss Penko, and take her for a drive?

155.speaker: PENGUIN
155.japanese: 夏とは言ったけど今年のとはいってないでしょう
155.english: I know I said summer, but I didn't say it would be this summer.

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.japanese: 来年かもしれないし　再来年かもしれないし　十年後の夏かもしれないよ
156.english: It could be next year, or even the year after that. Or even ten years from now.

157.speaker: SASAKO
157.japanese: そんな長いスパンの話なんですか
157.english: Was this really supposed to take that much time?

158.speaker: PANDA
158.japanese: もう　今からチョロっと告白してきなよ
158.english: Why don't you just go ask her out real quick—

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: チョロっとって　ちょっと待ってよ
159.english: What do you mean, real quick?! Wait a minute! I think it's a good idea. Why don't you go ask her out? What?! Well, I have to prepare my heart if I'm going to confess.

160.speaker: PENGUIN
160.japanese: いやいや　その前に心の準備の用意の前振りをだね
160.english: Er, um... and before that, I have to get ready to start to prepare my heart.

161.speaker: SASAKO
161.japanese: でも早く告白しないと　ペン子さん取られちゃうかもしれないですよ
161.english: But if you don't hurry and confess, someone might beat you to it.

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.japanese: けど　ふられたらどうしよう
162.english: But what if I get rejected?

163.speaker: POLAR BEAR
163.japanese: 大丈夫だよ　まだふられたわけじゃないんだから
163.english: It'll be okay. You haven't been rejected yet.

165.speaker: POLAR BEAR
165.japanese: ちゃんと告白して　ふられようよ
165.english: First ask her out, and then get rejected.

168.speaker: PENGUIN
168.japanese: いつかの夏にと思ってたけど
168.english: I was thinking of some future summer,

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.japanese: もう告白してしまおうかな
169.english: but maybe I'll just ask her out.

171.speaker: PANDA
171.japanese: そうだよ　ふられるなら　早いほうがいいよ
171.english: Yeah! If you're going to be rejected, you should get it over with.

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.english: All right! I'm going to do it!

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.japanese: これで　ようやく彼女の名前も分かるしね
174.english: And then I'll finally know her name for sure. What?

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: ペン子さんじゃないの

177.speaker: PENGUIN
177.english: Huh? Didn't I tell you? "Miss Penko" is the name I gave her. You don't mean... that you don't know her name?

181.speaker: PENGUIN
181.japanese: じゃ　笹子さんは名前も知らない花をきれいだなって思ったことはないですか
181.english: Then tell me, Miss Sasako, haven't you ever thought that a flower you didn't know the name of was pretty?

182.speaker: PENGUIN
182.japanese: 名前も知らない美味しい魚を食べたことはないですか
182.english: Haven't you ever eaten a delicious fish that you didn't know the name of?

183.speaker: PENGUIN
183.japanese: 名前も知らない曲に心揺さぶれたことはないですか
183.english: Haven't you ever been moved by a song you didn't know the name of?

184.speaker: PENGUIN
184.japanese: 名前も知らない未知の風景に美しいと思ったことはないですか
184.english: Haven't you ever thought the scenery

185.speaker: SASAKO
185.japanese: 分かりましたから　もう行ってください
185.english: I get it, so please, just go. of an unknown place was beautiful?

187.speaker: SASAKO
187.japanese: 名前も知らないんですね
187.english: He doesn't even know her name.

188.speaker: SASAKO
188.english: I wonder if he'll be okay.

189.speaker: PENKO
189.japanese: ありがとうございました

191.speaker: PENGUIN
191.japanese: 今日はサービス券もらいに来たんじゃないです
191.english: I didn't come today to get  service coupons!

192.speaker: PENGUIN
192.japanese: 言わなくていい言葉だった
192.english: I didn't have to mention that...

193.speaker: PENGUIN
193.japanese: 待とう　人がいなくなるのを
193.english: I'm going to wait... until everyone leaves.

195.speaker: PENKO
195.japanese: ありがとうございました

196.speaker: PENGUIN
196.japanese: いまだ　今しかない　でも緊張してきた
196.english: Now's my chance. Now's my only chance. But I'm getting nervous.

197.speaker: PENGUIN
197.japanese: こういう時どうするんだっけ
197.english: What am I supposed to do at times like these?

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.japanese: 人という字3回書いて呑むんだ
198.english: I write "person" on my hand and swallow it.

199.speaker: PENGUIN
199.english: Or, wait... Since I'm a penguin, am I supposed to write "penguin" three times and swallow it?

201.speaker: PENGUIN
201.japanese: そんなたくさんの文字呑めるか
201.english: How the heck am I supposed to swallow that many letters?!

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: すみません　大きいな声出して
203.english: I'm sorry for being so loud!

204.speaker: PENKO
204.japanese: いいえ　いつもありがとうございます
204.english: No, thank you for coming by all the time.

205.speaker: PENGUIN
205.japanese: いえ　そんな大したこと

206.speaker: PENKO
206.japanese: 分かります　すごく好きなんだなって
206.english: I can tell that you're in love...

208.speaker: PENKO
208.japanese: ありがとうございました

211.speaker: PENGUIN
211.japanese: 前からあなたの事が好きでした

212.speaker: PENGUIN
212.japanese: 僕とデートしてください
212.english: Please go on a date with me!

213.speaker: PENGUIN
213.japanese: 日曜日駅前で一時にまってます
213.english: I'll be waiting in front of the station on Sunday at 1 PM! Huh?

215.speaker: SASAKO
215.japanese: あれからペンギンさん　毎日パン屋さんに行ってデートに誘ってるらしいですよ
215.english: Apparently, Mr. Penguin has been asking her out every day since then. Today's the fourth day in a row.

216.speaker: SASAKO
216.english: Apparently he's going to keep trying until he gets a yes.

219.speaker: SASAKO
219.japanese: ペンギンさん頑張ってるよね

220.speaker: POLAR BEAR
220.japanese: 笹子さんは毎日毎日しつこく誘われたらどうなの
220.english: How would you feel if someone asked you out persistently every day, Miss Sasako?

221.speaker: SASAKO
221.japanese: え　それは嫌ですけど
221.english: Huh? Well, I wouldn't like that...

223.speaker: SASAKO
223.japanese: 幸せなんじゃないですかね
223.english: It must feel nice, to have someone

224.japanese: こんなふうに一途に思われたら
224.english: feel so strongly about just you.

227.speaker: PANDA
227.japanese: 笹子さんは一週間　毎日毎日しつこくされるのはどうなの
227.english: How would you feel if someone persistently asked you out every day for a week, Miss Sasako?

229.speaker: PENGUIN
229.japanese: 前からあなたの事が好きでした

230.speaker: PENGUIN
230.japanese: 僕とデートしてください
230.english: Please go on a date with me!

231.speaker: PENGUIN
231.japanese: 日曜日駅前で一時にまってます
231.english: I'll be waiting in front of the station on Sunday at 1 PM!

232.speaker: PENKO
232.japanese: 日曜日って明日ですよね

233.speaker: PENGUIN
233.japanese: うん　はい　急ですね　すみません
233.english: Uh, yes! I'm sorry, it's rather sudden.

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.japanese: 僕らはね　最初から愛し合っていたんじゃないかな
236.english: I think that we both loved each other from the start.

237.speaker: PENGUIN
237.japanese: 一週間毎日パン屋さんに行って　告白をしたわけだよ
237.english: I went to the bakery every day for weekand kept asking her out. I see...

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.japanese: でね　とうとう一週間目のことだよ
238.english: And then on the last day of that week...

239.speaker: PENGUIN
239.japanese: それでさ　ペン美ちゃんがね

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: あ　彼女ペン子ちゃんじゃなくて　ペン美ちゃんって名前だったんだけど
240.english: Oh, her name is Penmi, not Penko.

241.speaker: PENGUIN
241.japanese: ペン美ちゃんがどうしたって聞いてみて
241.english: You should totally ask me what Penmi did next. This is the fifth time.

242.speaker: SASAKO
242.japanese: 聞いたほうがいいんですか

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.japanese: だから　ペン美ちゃんがどうしたか聞いてみて
243.english: Ask me what Penmi did next.

244.speaker: SASAKO
244.japanese: ペン美ちゃんがどうしたんですか？

245.speaker: PENGUIN
245.japanese: 日曜日って明日ですかって聞いてきたの

247.speaker: PENGUIN
247.japanese: きっと僕たちは　愛し合う運命だったんだよ
247.english: It was fate for us to fall in love with each other.

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: あ　パン食べて　いいから　遠慮なく食べて
248.english: Oh, have some bread. No need to hold back, dig in!

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.english: Well, then, see you again tomorrow!

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: 明日は何回聞けばいいのかな
250.english: I wonder how many times we'll have to ask him tomorrow.

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.japanese: ペン美ちゃんまだかな
252.english: I wonder if Penmi is here yet.

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.japanese: まだちょっと早かったかな
253.english: Maybe I was a little early.

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: おい　ペン美ちゃん

256.speaker: PENKO
256.japanese: え　あたしペン子だけど

258.speaker: PENKA
258.japanese: ちょっと　どういうこと？

259.speaker: PENGUIN
259.japanese: え！ペン美ちゃんがもう一人

260.speaker: PENKA
260.japanese: 何言ってるの　わたし　ペン花よ
260.english: What are you talking about? My name is Penka! Huh?!

261.speaker: PENNA
261.japanese: ちょっとあんた　あたしのこと好きだったんじゃないの
261.english: Hey, I thought you said you loved me!

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: あれ　君がペン美ちゃん？
262.english: What the?! Are you Penmi? I'm Penna!

264.speaker: PENJOLINA
264.english: What's the meaning of this? Y-You've got it all wrong, Penmi!

267.speaker: PENUELLE
267.japanese: ちょっと　ペンギンさん

274.speaker: PENMI
274.english: What's the meaning of this? Um... I'm not sure myself.

275.speaker: GIRLS
275.english: What's the meaning of this?! P-Penmi!

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.japanese: ペン美ちゃん　ペン美ちゃん　助けて

278.speaker: PENGUIN
278.japanese: まさか七人いるなんて思わなかった
278.english: I never would have thought there were seven of them.

279.speaker: PENGUIN
279.japanese: 毎日違う子に告白してたなんて
279.english: I had no idea I was asking out someone different each day.

280.speaker: POLAR BEAR
280.japanese: パン屋さんのシフトのせいだ
280.english: It's because of the shifts at the bakery. Curse those shifts.

282.speaker: SASAKO
282.english: Already? I can feel their presence.

284.speaker: PANDA
284.japanese: ペンギンさん　告白できてよかったね
284.english: It's good that Mr. Penguin was finally able to confess.

285.speaker: SASAKO
285.japanese: これで　良かったんですかね
285.english: I wonder if this is how it should have ended up.

286.speaker: POLAR BEAR
286.japanese: 笹子さんは　毎日毎日しつこくノロケ話を聞かされるのってどうなの
286.english: How would you feel if you had to listen to someone gush about their loved one every day?

288.speaker: PANDA
288.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

290.speaker: PANDA
290.japanese: なんか落ち着かないね

292.speaker: PANDA
292.japanese: ペンギンさんに何か不吉なことが起きなければいいけど
292.english: I hope nothing bad happens to you, Mr. Penguin.

293.speaker: PENGUIN
293.english: This is reserved just for me?

294.speaker: PANDA
294.japanese: もしかしてペンギンさん　プチじゃない整形した
294.english: Could it be that you had some work done that's not minor?

295.speaker: PENGUIN
295.japanese: してません　けどなんか落ち着かないね
295.english: I have not. However, I'm feeling a bit uneasy, too.

297.speaker: POLAR BEAR
297.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

298.speaker: POLAR BEAR
298.english: will be fifty times bigger in size.

299.speaker: PENGUIN
299.english: What is? What's going to be fifty times bigger? Miss Sasako, end it, please.
